verses.roman:
tāś ca saubha-pater māyā
divyāstrai rukmiṇī-sutaḥ
kṣaṇena nāśayām āsa
naiśaṁ tama ivoṣṇa-guḥ

synonyms: tāḥ—those; ca—and; saubha-pateḥ—of the master of Saubha; māyāḥ—the magic illusions; divya—divine; astraiḥ—with weapons; rukmiṇī-sutaḥ—the son of Rukmiṇī (Pradyumna); kṣaṇena—in an instant; nāśayām āsa—destroyed; naiśam—of the night; tamaḥ—the darkness; iva—as; uṣṇa—warm; guḥ—whose rays (the sun).
translation: With His divine weapons Pradyumna instantly destroyed all of Śālva's magic illusions, in the same way that the warm rays of the sun dissipate the darkness of night.
